gradethis 0.2.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Graded object for submission value

Source: R/graded.R
graded.Rd

The return value from graded should be returned by every *-check chunk when used with grade_learnr().

graded(correct, message = NULL)

pass(message = getOption("gradethis.pass", "Correct!"), env = parent.frame())

fail(message = getOption("gradethis.fail", "Incorrect"), env = parent.frame())

pass_if_equal(
  y,
  message = getOption("gradethis.pass", "Correct!"),
  x = get(".result", envir = env),
  env = parent.frame()
)

fail_if_equal(
  y,
  message = getOption("gradethis.fail", "Incorrect"),
  x = get(".result", envir = env),
  env = parent.frame()
)

Arguments

correct

A logical value of whether or not the checked code is correct.
message

A character string of the message to be displayed.
env

environment to evaluate the glue message
y

Required value in which to compare x. Comparison is done using testthat::compare(x, y)
x

First item in the comparison. Typically, this will be the user result

Details

graded() objects are signaled to the calling functions.

  • grade_result() ignores when grades are created. graded() objects must be returned

  • grade_code() handles graded() objects internally

  • grade_this() will stop execution once a pass(), pass_if_equal(), fail(), fail_if_equal(), or grade() is called. To generate programmatic grades, use graded() or if statements around pass*() and fail*()

Functions

  • graded: Programatic function to produce a graded a result.

  • pass: Produce a passing grade

  • fail: Produce a failing grade

  • pass_if_equal: Produce a passing grade only if testthat::compare() passes on x and y

  • fail_if_equal: Produce a failing grade only if testthat::compare() passes on x and y

Contents
